title: Noar Linhas Aéreas
text:
Noar Linhas Aéreas S/A (Nordeste Aviação Regional Linhas Aéreas) was a Brazilian domestic airline with headquarters in <a href="Caruaru">Caruaru</a>, <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a>. Regular scheduled services started on June 14, 2010.
History.
The company's main objective is to operate in the market of scheduled regional flights on the <a href="Northeast%20Region%2C%20Brazil">northeast region</a> of Brazil, connecting its major centers. It was founded in 2009 and on May 14, 2010 the <a href="National%20Civil%20Aviation%20Agency%20of%20Brazil">National Civil Aviation Agency (ANAC)</a> granted the final authorization to start operations. Flights began on June 14, 2010.
On October 1, 2010, Noar started an operational agreement with <a href="Gol%20Airlines">Gol Airlines</a> in which Noar acted as a feeder carrier for Gol at <a href="Recife%20Airport">Recife</a>. This agreement was suspended in September 2011.
Following operational complications after its July 13, 2011 accident, on September 20, 2011 Noar requested to ANAC the temporary suspension of its services.
On November 26, 2014 Noar lost its operational license.

Airline affinity program.
Noar Linhas Aéreas had no <a href="Frequent-flyer%20program">Frequent Flyer Program</a>.
